title: How to Change the Download Location in Chrome

steps.title: Open Chrome on your computer.
steps.content: Open Chrome on your computer. Find and click the icon on your computer to open Chrome.

steps.title: Go to chrome://settings in your browser.
steps.content: Go to chrome://settings in your browser. [1] X Expert Source Mobile Kangaroo Computer & Phone Repair Specialists Expert Interview. 11 September 2019. This will open Chrome's browser settings. Click the address bar at the top. Type "chrome://settings". Press ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return on your keyboard.

steps.title: Scroll down and click the Advanced drop-down.
steps.content: Scroll down and click the Advanced drop-down. [2] X Expert Source Mobile Kangaroo Computer & Phone Repair Specialists Expert Interview. 11 September 2019. You'll find this option at the bottom of the basic settings below the "On startup" section. It will expand more options.

steps.title: Scroll down and find the "Downloads" section.
steps.content: Scroll down and find the "Downloads" section. [3] X Expert Source Mobile Kangaroo Computer & Phone Repair Specialists Expert Interview. 11 September 2019. You can change your download settings here.

steps.title: Click the Change button next to "Location.
steps.content: Click the Change button next to "Location. " This will prompt you to select a folder to set as your new download location. You can see your current download location in the "Location" box.

steps.title: Select the folder you want to use as your download location.
steps.content: Select the folder you want to use as your download location. [4] X Expert Source Mobile Kangaroo Computer & Phone Repair Specialists Expert Interview. 11 September 2019. Click on the folder's name in the pop-up window to select it.

steps.title: Click Select on the bottom-right.
steps.content: Click Select on the bottom-right. This will confirm your selection, and save your new download location. Chrome will now save browser downloads to your new location.

steps.title: Open Chrome on your Android.
steps.content: Open Chrome on your Android. Find and click the icon on your Apps tray to open Chrome.

steps.title: Tap the ⋮ on the top-right.
steps.content: Tap the ⋮ on the top-right. It will open a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Tap Settings on the drop-down menu.
steps.content: Tap Settings on the drop-down menu. [5] X Expert Source Mobile Kangaroo Computer & Phone Repair Specialists Expert Interview. 11 September 2019. This will open your browser settings on a new page.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Downloads.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Downloads . [6] X Expert Source Mobile Kangaroo Computer & Phone Repair Specialists Expert Interview. 11 September 2019. You can find this option near the bottom of the Settings menu. It will open your download settings.

steps.title: Tap Download location.
steps.content: Tap Download location . This will open a list of the available folders you can set as your download location. You can see your current download location's file directory here.

steps.title: Select the folder you want to use as your download location.
steps.content: Select the folder you want to use as your download location. [7] X Expert Source Mobile Kangaroo Computer & Phone Repair Specialists Expert Interview. 11 September 2019. This will set the selected folder as your download location in Chrome.
